comment: Dr. Rodriguez was by far the best professor I have ever had at KSU. She cares about all her students and wants to get to know every person. The class is very group-heavy as there is a semester-long project on a nonprofit of your choice but she is always willing to help and guide. Her tests are very heavy but they are open book/notes and no webcam.

She cares for her students, and she makes sure that they learn the material well. It is a semester-long project that is very difficult and confusing, but she will try her best to help you. She is not a harsh grader, but her expectations are high. Tests are also difficult, but she will help you get a good score. Overall, I would take her again.

Dr Rodriguez is hard but fair. She is willing to offer extensions on assignments if you communicate with her. She may make you cry but only because she pushes you to your true potential of greatness. She goes above and beyond for her students. Her test are hard but passable. I failed a few but passed majority

Literally the WORST class and professor I have had at KSU. This is suppose to be an intro class into nonprofits and it was more like a graduate level, advanced class. You have to create your own nonprofit which was outrageously difficult, then it is ripped to shreds by brutal "sharks" she recruits as if you've worked in the industry for 10+ years.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: You will definitely be hands down in this class. A big chunk of your grade is based on a semester-long project that you have to work on with a group so be prepared to know the materials and work with other people as team members. Dr. Rodriguez was helpful in guiding me with the project and helping me know the material from the textbook.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: 4 exams and 1 group project worth a huge chunk of your grade. The project gave 0 good guidelines and even following the rubric you'd fail things.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader
